translated: In brief, from the very beginning one should eat and rely on only beneficial food.

original: de yang drang srong tsa ra kas /
analyzed: de yang drang srong tsa ra kas /
translated: The sage Caraka explains:

original: mi 'phrod zas zos las gyur na //
analyzed: mi 'phrod zas zos las gyur na //
translated: If one eats unwholesome food,

original: slon dang khrus kyis sbyang bya zhing //
analyzed: slon dang khrus kyis sbyang bya zhing //
translated: one should purify it with emesis and purgation.

original: rnam par bsal nas zhi ba'am //🔽dang por 'phrod pa bsten pas so //
analyzed: rnam par bsal nas zhi ba'am // dang por 'phrod pa bsten pas so //
translated: If one completely eliminates it,

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: one will be peaceful by relying on wholesome food from the beginning.🔽One who is diligent, relies on oil, has strong digestive heat,

original: rtsol can snum bsten drod che dang // dar la ba bcing nyams stobs ldan //
analyzed: rtsol can snum bsten drod che dang // dar la ba bcing nyams stobs ldan //
translated: is young, has strong vitality,

original: goms par zos dang cung zad zos //
analyzed: goms par zos dang cung zad zos //
translated: is accustomed to eating, or eats little,

original: mi 'phrod gyur kyang gnod mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi 'phrod gyur kyang gnod mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: will not be harmed even by unwholesome food.

original: gang la rtsol zhing las su bya ba yod ba de ni rtsol bcas te /
analyzed: gang la rtsol zhing las su bya ba yod ba de ni rtsol bcas te /
translated: One who is diligent, who has something to strive for and work on,

original: rtsol ba can des ni zas dang btung ba dang / sman mi 'phrod pa bsten kyang nad du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsol ba can des ni zas dang btung ba dang / sman mi 'phrod pa bsten kyang nad du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: even if one relies on unwholesome food and drink and medicine, it will not become a disease.

original: de bzhin du snum shas cher bsten pa dang / pho ba'i me drod che ba dag dang / dar la bab cing na tshod bde ba dang / de bzhin du nyams stobs dang ldan zhing shin tu bsngags par bya ba'i stobs yod pa des mi 'phrod pa dag zos kyang nad du mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du snum shas cher bsten pa dang / pho ba'i me drod che ba dag dang / dar la bab cing na tshod bde ba dang / de bzhin du nyams stobs dang ldan zhing shin tu bsngags par bya ba'i stobs yod pa des mi 'phrod pa dag zos kyang nad du mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Similarly, those who rely on a lot of oil, have strong digestive heat, are in the prime of life, are healthy, and have strong faculties and are very praiseworthy, will not get sick even if they eat incompatible foods.

original: de bzhin du goms par byas shing rtag tu zos pa dang / cung zad cung zad zos pa dag gis kyang nad du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du goms par byas shing rtag tu zos pa dang / cung zad cung zad zos pa dag gis kyang nad du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, those who are accustomed to eating and always eat, and those who eat little by little, will not get sick.

original: zas dang skom la sogs pa mi 'phrod cing mi mthun par 'gyur ba yin yang skyes bu de la gnod pa'i nad du mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: zas dang skom la sogs pa mi 'phrod cing mi mthun par 'gyur ba yin yang skyes bu de la gnod pa'i nad du mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Even if food and drink are incompatible and unsuited, they will not cause illness for that person.

original: nad med pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad med pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will remain healthy.

original: dris pa gang mi 'phrod ba'i zas skom zos pa na goms pa'am /
analyzed: dris pa gang mi 'phrod ba'i zas skom zos pa na goms pa'am /
translated: If one eats food and drink that is incompatible and unsuited, due to being accustomed to it or

original: nyung zad cig bsten pa'i rgyus dus dang yul la ltos nas /
analyzed: nyung zad cig bsten pa'i rgyus dus dang yul la ltos nas /
translated: relying on it little by little, in time and place,

original: goms pas lus la gnod pa med cing bde bar 'gyur ba de mod la spang bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: goms pas lus la gnod pa med cing bde bar 'gyur ba de mod la spang bar bya ba'am /
translated: By becoming accustomed to it, it is harmless to the body and becomes comfortable.

original: 'on te rim gyis spang /
analyzed: 'on te rim gyis spang /
translated: Should it be abandoned immediately or gradually?

original: de bzhin du gang lus la phan zhing 'phrod pa dag kyang mod la cig car bstan par bya ba'am de lta ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang lus la phan zhing 'phrod pa dag kyang mod la cig car bstan par bya ba'am de lta ma yin /
translated: Similarly, should that which is beneficial and suitable for the body be introduced immediately or not?

original: de gnyis kyis rim pa spang ba dang / blang ba'i tshul bstan pa smras pa ni /🔽mi 'phrod cha yis goms bya'am //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis rim pa spang ba dang / blang ba'i tshul bstan pa smras pa ni / mi 'phrod cha yis goms bya'am //
translated: The method of abandoning and adopting those two is taught by the following verse.🔽One should become accustomed to what is unsuitable

original: cha yi cha yis yongs su spangs //
analyzed: cha yi cha yis yongs su spangs //
translated: by degrees, or by degrees abandon what is suitable.

original: phan pa'ang de bzhin bsten bya ste //
analyzed: phan pa'ang de bzhin bsten bya ste //
translated: One should also rely on what is beneficial,

original: 'di dag gnyis gsum gyis chod bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽gang mi 'phrod cing @103a * //
analyzed: 'di dag gnyis gsum gyis chod bya // zhes bya ba la / gang mi 'phrod cing @103a * //
translated: but these two should be interrupted by a third.

original: phan pa ma yin pa bsten cing goms par bya ba de yang /
analyzed: phan pa ma yin pa bsten cing goms par bya ba de yang /
translated: What is unsuitable and not beneficial should be relied upon and become accustomed to🔽by degrees.

original: cha yis goms par bya zhes bya ba rang gi tshad las de'i bzhi chas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: cha yis goms par bya zhes bya ba rang gi tshad las de'i bzhi chas spang bar bya'o //
translated: That is, one should abandon a quarter of one’s usual amount.

original: yang na shin tu shas cher zos pa ni /
analyzed: yang na shin tu shas cher zos pa ni /
translated: Or, if one has eaten too much,

original: cha'i yang cha shas su bgos pa ste /
analyzed: cha'i yang cha shas su bgos pa ste /
translated: one should divide the remainder into four parts and eat a quarter of it.

original: bcu drug char yang spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcu drug char yang spang bar bya'o //
translated: One should avoid all sixteen.

original: 'am zhes bya ba ni mi 'phrod pa yin kyang /
analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba ni mi 'phrod pa yin kyang /
translated: The word “or” indicates that even if something is not suitable,

original: gnod pa med pa dag mod la spangs pas lus la gnod bar 'gyur ba mthong bas bstan bcos rtsom pas 'am gyi sgra smos pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa dag mod la spangs pas lus la gnod bar 'gyur ba mthong bas bstan bcos rtsom pas 'am gyi sgra smos pa yin no //
translated: if it is seen that it does not harm the body when consumed, then it is permissible to use it.

original: de ltar spangs nas phan zhing 'phrod pa dag kyang de bzhin du rim pa de nyid kyis bsten par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar spangs nas phan zhing 'phrod pa dag kyang de bzhin du rim pa de nyid kyis bsten par bya ste /
translated: Having avoided those that are harmful, one should also use in the same way those that are beneficial and suitable.

original: 'phrog pa dag kyang bzhi cha 'am bzhi cha'i bzhi chas bsten bar bya'o //🔽de ltar mi 'phrod pa cha yis spang ba ste rim pa la ltos pa med par dor bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'phrog pa dag kyang bzhi cha 'am bzhi cha'i bzhi chas bsten bar bya'o // de ltar mi 'phrod pa cha yis spang ba ste rim pa la ltos pa med par dor bar bya ba'am /
translated: One should use those that are suitable but are of poor quality for one quarter or one-quarter of the time.

original: 'on te ltos pa dang bcas pas dor bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ltos pa dang bcas pas dor bar bya zhe na /
translated: In this way, one should avoid those that are unsuitable by degrees, without regard to the sequence, or should one avoid them with regard to the sequence?

original: 'di dag gnyis gsum gyis chod bya //🔽zhes smras pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag gnyis gsum gyis chod bya // zhes smras pa yin te /
translated: One should avoid them by two or three.

original: sngar bshad pa 'di dag ni zhag gnyis sam gsum gyis mi 'phrod pa'i nye bar mtshon pa thams cad med par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa 'di dag ni zhag gnyis sam gsum gyis mi 'phrod pa'i nye bar mtshon pa thams cad med par 'gyur bas /
translated: This means that all of the above that are unsuitable will be eliminated by two or three days.

original: bar du chod par byas la mi 'phrod pa de bzhi cha'am /
analyzed: bar du chod par byas la mi 'phrod pa de bzhi cha'am /
translated: They are the four that obstruct the attainment of enlightenment.🔽

original: bcu drug chas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcu drug chas spang bar bya'o //
translated: One should avoid the four or sixteen parts that are not suitable.

original: de bzhin du phan pa dag kyang zhag gnyis dang gsum gyis phan pa ma lus pa nye bar 'phel bar 'gyur bar /🔽bar gyis chod par byas la bzhi cha'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du phan pa dag kyang zhag gnyis dang gsum gyis phan pa ma lus pa nye bar 'phel bar 'gyur bar / bar gyis chod par byas la bzhi cha'am /
translated: Similarly, one should definitely rely on and cultivate the beneficial for two or three days, increasing all the beneficial without exception.

original: bcu drug chas nges par bsten cing goms par bya'o //
analyzed: bcu drug chas nges par bsten cing goms par bya'o //
translated: One should avoid the four or sixteen parts that are not suitable.🔽One should definitely rely on and cultivate the beneficial for two or three days, increasing all the beneficial without exception.

original: 'dir don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning here is as follows.

original: mi 'phrod pa goms par 'gyur ba'i cha gcig spangs la /
analyzed: mi 'phrod pa goms par 'gyur ba'i cha gcig spangs la /
translated: One should avoid one part of the unsuitable that is conducive to habituation.

original: mi 'phrod pa sum cha'i nang du 'phrod pa gcig bcug la bza'o //🔽de nas nyi ma gnyis pa la /
analyzed: mi 'phrod pa sum cha'i nang du 'phrod pa gcig bcug la bza'o // de nas nyi ma gnyis pa la /
translated: One should eat one part of the suitable mixed in with three parts of the unsuitable.

original: mi 'phrod pa'i goms pa'i cha bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'phrod pa'i goms pa'i cha bza' bar bya'o //
translated: On the second day, one should eat one part of the unsuitable that is conducive to habituation.

original: de ltar na mi 'phrod ba'i cha gcig gis chod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mi 'phrod ba'i cha gcig gis chod pa yin no //
translated: In that way, one part of the unsuitable is avoided.

original: nyi ma gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa la yang mi 'phrod pa'i cha gsum dang 'phrod pa'i cha gcig bsres te bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa la yang mi 'phrod pa'i cha gsum dang 'phrod pa'i cha gcig bsres te bza' bar bya'o //
translated: On the second, third, and fourth days, one should eat three parts of the unsuitable mixed with one part of the suitable.

original: nyi ma lnga ba la ni yang thams cad mi 'phrod pa bza'o //
analyzed: nyi ma lnga ba la ni yang thams cad mi 'phrod pa bza'o //
translated: On the fifth day, he should eat everything that is not suitable.

original: de ltar na mi 'phrod pa gnyis kyis chod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mi 'phrod pa gnyis kyis chod pa yin no //
translated: In this way, he is cut off by two unsuitable [foods].

original: zhag drug pa dang / bdun pa la mi 'phrod pa'i cha gsum dang / 'phrod pa'i cha gcig bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhag drug pa dang / bdun pa la mi 'phrod pa'i cha gsum dang / 'phrod pa'i cha gcig bza' bar bya'o //
translated: On the sixth and seventh days, he should eat three parts of unsuitable [food] and one part of suitable [food].

original: zhag dgu pa la ni thams cad mi 'phrod pa'o //
analyzed: zhag dgu pa la ni thams cad mi 'phrod pa'o //
translated: On the ninth day, everything is unsuitable.

original: de ltar na mi 'phrod pa cha gsum @103b gyis chod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mi 'phrod pa cha gsum @103b gyis chod pa yin no //
translated: In this way, he is cut off by three parts of unsuitable [food].

original: de bzhin du mi 'phrod pa'i cha gcig 'bri zhing de nyid phan pa'i cha bcug pa ltar yang nyi ma bcus mi 'phrod pa'i cha gnyis bcug par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi 'phrod pa'i cha gcig 'bri zhing de nyid phan pa'i cha bcug pa ltar yang nyi ma bcus mi 'phrod pa'i cha gnyis bcug par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, he should reduce one part of unsuitable [food] and insert that very [amount] of beneficial [food]. In this way, in ten days, he should insert two parts of unsuitable [food].

original: yang de bzhin du zhag bcus snga ma bzhin du mi 'phrod pa'i cha gsum gyis chod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang de bzhin du zhag bcus snga ma bzhin du mi 'phrod pa'i cha gsum gyis chod pa yin no //
translated: Again, in the same way, in ten days, as before, he is cut off by three parts of unsuitable [food].

original: de bzhin du mi 'phrod pa'i cha bzhi pa yang zhag bcus spangs la /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi 'phrod pa'i cha bzhi pa yang zhag bcus spangs la /
translated: In the same way, he should abandon the fourth part of unsuitable [food] in ten days,

original: 'phrod pa'i cha gsum gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phrod pa'i cha gsum gzhug par bya'o //
translated: and insert three parts of suitable [food].

original: de ltar na zhag bcus spang ba dang / blang ba goms par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na zhag bcus spang ba dang / blang ba goms par byas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in ten days, one has become accustomed to abandoning and taking.

original: gzhan dag ni 'di las gzhan du 'chad de /🔽nyi ma dang po la mi 'phrod pa las cha gcig spangs la /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'di las gzhan du 'chad de / nyi ma dang po la mi 'phrod pa las cha gcig spangs la /
translated: Others explain this differently.🔽On the first day, one should eat one part of what is not suitable and one part of what is suitable.

original: 'phrod pa las cha gcig bcug la de nas zhag gcig bsdad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phrod pa las cha gcig bcug la de nas zhag gcig bsdad par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should rest for one day.

original: de nas nyi ma gnyis pa la mi 'phrod pa thams cad bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas nyi ma gnyis pa la mi 'phrod pa thams cad bza' bar bya ste /
translated: Then, on the second day, one should eat everything that is not suitable.

original: de ltar na gcig gnyis chod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gcig gnyis chod par gyur pa'o //
translated: Thus, one has skipped one day.

original: de nas nyi ma gsum pa la mi 'phrod pa'i cha gnyis bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma gsum pa la mi 'phrod pa'i cha gnyis bsten par bya'o //
translated: Then, on the third day, one should eat two parts of what is not suitable.

original: de nas nyi ma bzhi pa la thams cad mi 'phrod pa bza' ba dang / de bzhin du zhag lnga pa la yang thams cad mi 'phrod pa bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma bzhi pa la thams cad mi 'phrod pa bza' ba dang / de bzhin du zhag lnga pa la yang thams cad mi 'phrod pa bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Then, on the fourth day, one should eat everything that is not suitable, and likewise, on the fifth day, one should eat everything that is not suitable.

original: de ltar na nyi ma gnyis kyis chod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nyi ma gnyis kyis chod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one has skipped two days.

original: zhag drug pa la mi 'phrod pa las cha gcig 'phrod pa las cha gsum bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhag drug pa la mi 'phrod pa las cha gcig 'phrod pa las cha gsum bza' bar bya'o //
translated: On the sixth day, one should eat one part of what is not suitable and three parts of what is suitable.

original: de nas bdun pa dang brgyad pa dang ; dgu pa'i nyin zhag la thams cad mi 'phrod pa bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bdun pa dang brgyad pa dang ; dgu pa'i nyin zhag la thams cad mi 'phrod pa bza' bar bya ste /
translated: Then, on the seventh, eighth, and ninth days, one should eat only what is not suitable.

original: de ltar gsum gyis chod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gsum gyis chod pa'o //
translated: In this way, it is interrupted by three days.

original: de nas zhag bdun pa la mi 'phrod pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhag bdun pa la mi 'phrod pa'o //
translated: Then, on the seventh day, it is not suitable.

original: de nas zhag bcu gcig pa la 'phrod pa las cha gsum mi 'phrod pa las cha gcig bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zhag bcu gcig pa la 'phrod pa las cha gsum mi 'phrod pa las cha gcig bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Then, on the eleventh day, one should eat three parts of what is suitable and one part of what is not suitable.

original: de'i 'og tu nyi ma bcu gnyis pa la thams cad 'phrod par bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nyi ma bcu gnyis pa la thams cad 'phrod par bza' bar bya'o //
translated: After that, on the twelfth day, one should eat only what is suitable.

original: de ltar zhag gis chod par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar zhag gis chod par byas nas /
translated: In this way, having made it interrupted by days,

original: zhag bcu gsum pa la 'phrod pa'i cha gnyis dang mi 'phrod pa'i cha gnyis bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhag bcu gsum pa la 'phrod pa'i cha gnyis dang mi 'phrod pa'i cha gnyis bza' bar bya'o //
translated: on the thirteenth day, one should eat two parts of what is suitable and two parts of what is not suitable.

original: de nas zhag bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga ba la 'phrod pa 'ba' zhig bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zhag bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga ba la 'phrod pa 'ba' zhig bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Then, on the fourteenth and fifteenth days, one should eat only what is suitable.

original: de ltar na nyin zhag gnyis gnyis kyis chod par gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nyin zhag gnyis gnyis kyis chod par gyur ba yin no //
translated: In this way, it is interrupted by two days.

original: de nas nyi ma bcu drug pa las 'phrod pa las gsum dang / mi 'phrod pa las cha gcig bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma bcu drug pa las 'phrod pa las gsum dang / mi 'phrod pa las cha gcig bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Then, on the sixteenth day, one should eat one part from the three that are suitable and one part from the one that is not suitable.

original: de nas zhag bcu bdun pa dang / bco brgyad pa dang / bcu dgu ba'i grangs kyis bcad pa'i nyin zhag la thams cad kyang @104a * //
analyzed: de nas zhag bcu bdun pa dang / bco brgyad pa dang / bcu dgu ba'i grangs kyis bcad pa'i nyin zhag la thams cad kyang @104a * //
translated: Then, on the seventeenth, eighteenth, and nineteenth days, one should eat all the parts that are suitable and beneficial.

original: 'phrod cing phan par 'gyur ba bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'phrod cing phan par 'gyur ba bza' bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should eat the food that is suitable and beneficial.

original: de ltar nyin zhag gsum gyis chod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar nyin zhag gsum gyis chod pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the three days are interrupted.

original: de'i 'og tu zhag nyi shu pa nas btsams te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhag nyi shu pa nas btsams te /
translated: After that, beginning from the twentieth day,

original: cha bzhi po thams cad kyang phan zhing 'phrod pa las bza' bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: cha bzhi po thams cad kyang phan zhing 'phrod pa las bza' bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: one should eat all four parts that are suitable and beneficial.

original: la la 'di skad 'chad de /
analyzed: la la 'di skad 'chad de /
translated: Some explain it like this:

original: kha zas gnod pa goms pa'i cha gcig bor la /
analyzed: kha zas gnod pa goms pa'i cha gcig bor la /
translated: One should discard the one part of food that is harmful to get used to.

original: gnod pa'i kha zas cha gsum gyi nang du phan pa'i cha gcig bcug la /
analyzed: gnod pa'i kha zas cha gsum gyi nang du phan pa'i cha gcig bcug la /
translated: One should put one part of beneficial food into the three parts of harmful food.

original: ji srid goms par gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid goms par gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsten par bya'o //
translated: One should rely on this for as long as one gets used to it.

original: de ltar na gnod pa ni gcig gis chod pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na gnod pa ni gcig gis chod pa yin la /
translated: In this way, the harm is interrupted by one.

original: phan pa'i zas ni gsum gyis chod pa yin zhing /
analyzed: phan pa'i zas ni gsum gyis chod pa yin zhing /
translated: The beneficial food is determined by three parts.

original: gang gi phyir gnod pa'i cha las ni cha gcig bor ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnod pa'i cha las ni cha gcig bor ba yin la /
translated: Because one part is discarded from the harmful part,

original: phan pa las kyang cha gsum bor nas /
analyzed: phan pa las kyang cha gsum bor nas /
translated: and three parts are discarded from the beneficial part,

original: cha gcig bcug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha gcig bcug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and one part is added.

original: de bzhin du cha gnyis kyi sa chod pa ni gnod pa dang / phan pa gnyis las cha gnyis dor te cha gnyis gnyis bsres la /
analyzed: de bzhin du cha gnyis kyi sa chod pa ni gnod pa dang / phan pa gnyis las cha gnyis dor te cha gnyis gnyis bsres la /
translated: Similarly, the determination by two parts is that two parts are discarded from the two, harmful and beneficial, and two parts are mixed.

original: ji srid goms par gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsten par bya'o //🔽de'i 'og tu cha gsum gyis chod pa ste /
analyzed: ji srid goms par gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsten par bya'o // de'i 'og tu cha gsum gyis chod pa ste /
translated: One should rely on it for as long as one becomes accustomed to it.

original: gnod pa'i cha gsum dor la /
analyzed: gnod pa'i cha gsum dor la /
translated: After that, the determination by three parts is that three parts of harm are discarded,

original: cha gcig pa ste phan pa'i cha gsum gyi nang du bsres te /
analyzed: cha gcig pa ste phan pa'i cha gsum gyi nang du bsres te /
translated: and one part, three parts of benefit, are mixed.

original: ji srid goms par gyur pa de srid kyi bar du goms par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid goms par gyur pa de srid kyi bar du goms par bya'o //
translated: One should become accustomed to it for as long as one becomes accustomed to it.

original: de'i 'og tu phan pa'i zas dang sman cha bzhir rdzogs pa bsten par bya'o zhes ze ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phan pa'i zas dang sman cha bzhir rdzogs pa bsten par bya'o zhes ze ro //
translated: After that, one should rely on the beneficial food and medicine that is complete in four parts.

original: de bas na drang srong tsa ra kas kyang /
analyzed: de bas na drang srong tsa ra kas kyang /
translated: Therefore, the sage Caraka also says:

original: de phyir gnod pa'ang goms byas pa //
analyzed: de phyir gnod pa'ang goms byas pa //
translated: Therefore, even harm is to be cultivated.

original: rim gyis yongs su spang bar bya //
analyzed: rim gyis yongs su spang bar bya //
translated: Gradually, it is to be completely abandoned.

analyzed: de gsum nyes pa rnam gsum ni //

original: brtags nas rab tu sbyang bar bya //
analyzed: brtags nas rab tu sbyang bar bya //

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: As it is said:🔽That weakening is of three kinds: fasting, digestion, and fomentation.

original: nyams smad par bya ba de ni smyung ba dang / zhu bar byas pa dang / dugs bya ba rnam pa gsum yod pa de nyes pa rnam gsum ni zhes pa /🔽chung ngu dang / bar ma dang / chen po'i tshul brtags shing rim pa 'dis /
analyzed: nyams smad par bya ba de ni smyung ba dang / zhu bar byas pa dang / dugs bya ba rnam pa gsum yod pa de nyes pa rnam gsum ni zhes pa / chung ngu dang / bar ma dang / chen po'i tshul brtags shing rim pa 'dis /
translated: The three faults are the three modes of small, medium, and great.

original: chung ngu la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i dbye bas so sor brtags shing dpyad nas rab tu sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: chung ngu la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i dbye bas so sor brtags shing dpyad nas rab tu sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: By the division of small, etc. faults, having examined and analyzed them, one should apply the remedies.

original: de la chung la smyung ba phan //
analyzed: de la chung la smyung ba phan //
translated: Fasting is beneficial for the mild one.

original: 'bring la smyung dang gzhu bya ba //
analyzed: 'bring la smyung dang gzhu bya ba //
translated: For the medium one, fasting and purgation.

original: chen po la ni sbyang ba ste //🔽de yis dri ma rtsa nas 'byin //
analyzed: chen po la ni sbyang ba ste // de yis dri ma rtsa nas 'byin //
translated: For the great one, cleansing.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: By that, the stains are removed from the root.

original: de la zhes pa nyes pa rnam pa gsum po la /
analyzed: de la zhes pa nyes pa rnam pa gsum po la /
translated: As for that, the three types of faults,

original: chung ngu la ni smyung bar gnas pa nyams dmad pa phan zhing rjes su mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: chung ngu la ni smyung bar gnas pa nyams dmad pa phan zhing rjes su mthun pa yin te /
translated: for the mild one, fasting, which is a hardship, is beneficial and suitable.

original: des kyang me dang rlung 'phel bar byas pas dper na rlung dang than pas chu'i tshogs nyung zhig gi gnas skems par byed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: des kyang me dang rlung 'phel bar byas pas dper na rlung dang than pas chu'i tshogs nyung zhig gi gnas skems par byed pa bzhin du /
translated: By that, the fire and wind are increased. For example, just as wind and drought dry up the abode of a little water,

original: 'di la phan par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di la phan par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: this is beneficial.

original: 'bring la zhes pa nyes pa'i stobs 'bring tsam du gyur pa lan ni smyung ba zhes bya ba zas bcad pa dang / de bzhin du gzhu ba zhes bya ba shu dag dang / pu shel tse la sogs pas phan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bring la zhes pa nyes pa'i stobs 'bring tsam du gyur pa lan ni smyung ba zhes bya ba zas bcad pa dang / de bzhin du gzhu ba zhes bya ba shu dag dang / pu shel tse la sogs pas phan pa yin te /
translated: For the medium one, the strength of the fault is just medium. The remedy is fasting, which is abstaining from food, and likewise, purgation, which is beneficial with cumin, pushel tse, and so on.

original: de gnyis ni nyes pa 'bring po 'joms te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni nyes pa 'bring po 'joms te /
translated: Those two conquer medium faults.

original: dper na chu'i tshogs ha cang mi che ba la thal ba dang ; sa rdul dag dang 'dres pa'i rlung dang than pas chu'i tshogs ha cang mi che ba skems par byed pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na chu'i tshogs ha cang mi che ba la thal ba dang ; sa rdul dag dang 'dres pa'i rlung dang than pas chu'i tshogs ha cang mi che ba skems par byed pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, it is like a small amount of water being dried up by wind and heat mixed with dust.

original: che la zhes pa nyes pa mang po stobs dang ldan pa dag la ni sbyang ba ste /
analyzed: che la zhes pa nyes pa mang po stobs dang ldan pa dag la ni sbyang ba ste /
translated: For those with many powerful faults, purification is beneficial.

original: khrus dang slon la sogs pa'i tshul gyis nyams smad par bya ba phan pa yin te /
analyzed: khrus dang slon la sogs pa'i tshul gyis nyams smad par bya ba phan pa yin te /
translated: For example, it is like a person with a serious illness being cured by medicine.

original: gang gi phyir skyug sman la sogs pa sbyangs pas de yis dri ma zhes pa rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / bshang ba dang / gci ba la sogs pa rtsa ba nas 'byin cing gcod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyug sman la sogs pa sbyangs pas de yis dri ma zhes pa rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / bshang ba dang / gci ba la sogs pa rtsa ba nas 'byin cing gcod par 'gyur te /
translated: Because by purifying with emetics and so on, the stains of wind, bile, phlegm, feces, urine, and so on are completely removed and cut off.

original: dper na 'dam bu'i zhing chu med pa dag tu ni 'bras la sogs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba dang @115b 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dam bu'i zhing chu med pa dag tu ni 'bras la sogs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba dang @115b 'dra'o //
translated: For example, it is like rice not growing in a mud field without water.

original: de bas na nyams mthos pa'i ma zhu ba las byung ba la ni nyams dmad ba ma byas par zhi bar 'gyur ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de bas na nyams mthos pa'i ma zhu ba las byung ba la ni nyams dmad ba ma byas par zhi bar 'gyur ba ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, in one who has indigestion due to overeating, it is not pacified without reducing the indigestion.

original: nyams dmad bar gyur ba las byung ba la yang nyams brta ba byas par zhi bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams dmad bar gyur ba las byung ba la yang nyams brta ba byas par zhi bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: And in one who has indigestion due to under eating, it is not pacified by reducing the indigestion.

original: de bzhin nad gzhan dag la yang //
analyzed: de bzhin nad gzhan dag la yang //
translated: So also in other diseases.

original: rang nad gzhi las go bzlog pas //
analyzed: rang nad gzhi las go bzlog pas //
translated: One should treat them by reversing the cause of one’s own disease.

original: gso ba / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gso ba / zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Treating” means

original: de bzhin du chung ngu la sogs pa'i rim pa 'dis /
analyzed: de bzhin du chung ngu la sogs pa'i rim pa 'dis /
translated: in this way, by the sequence of small and so on,

original: rims la sogs pa'i nad gzhan dag la yang rang gi nad gzhi las go bzlog pa zhes pa /
analyzed: rims la sogs pa'i nad gzhan dag la yang rang gi nad gzhi las go bzlog pa zhes pa /
translated: one should treat other diseases such as fever by reversing the cause of one’s own disease.

original: rang gi nad kyi rgyu dang mi mthun pa'i sman gyis gso bar bya zhing bzlog par bya'o //🔽de yang rang gi nad gzhi yin pas na /
analyzed: rang gi nad kyi rgyu dang mi mthun pa'i sman gyis gso bar bya zhing bzlog par bya'o // de yang rang gi nad gzhi yin pas na /
translated: One should treat and reverse them with medicine that is not compatible with the cause of one’s own disease.🔽And that is the cause of one’s own disease,

original: rang gi nad gzhi ste /
analyzed: rang gi nad gzhi ste /
translated: so it is one’s own disease.

original: rang gi rgyu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is one’s own cause.

original: de las go bzlog pa ni de dang mi mthun pa ste /
analyzed: de las go bzlog pa ni de dang mi mthun pa ste /
translated: Reversing that is incompatible with it.

original: dper na tshim zhing brtas par byas pa las byung ba'i nad la nyams dmad bar bya ba dang / nyams dmad ba las byung ba'i nad de las bzlog pa ni brtan par bya ba yin pa dang / de bzhin du lci ba dang / snum pa dang /🔽grang ba la sogs pa las byung ba'i nad la de dang mi mthun pa yang ba dang / rtsub pa dang / dro bar bya ba dang / yang ba dang / rtsub pa dang / dro ba las byung ba'i nad la de dang mi mthun pa lci ba dang /
analyzed: dper na tshim zhing brtas par byas pa las byung ba'i nad la nyams dmad bar bya ba dang / nyams dmad ba las byung ba'i nad de las bzlog pa ni brtan par bya ba yin pa dang / de bzhin du lci ba dang / snum pa dang / grang ba la sogs pa las byung ba'i nad la de dang mi mthun pa yang ba dang / rtsub pa dang / dro bar bya ba dang / yang ba dang / rtsub pa dang / dro ba las byung ba'i nad la de dang mi mthun pa lci ba dang /
translated: For example, a disease arising from satisfaction and nourishment is to be emaciated, and a disease arising from emaciation is to be nourished.🔽Similarly, a disease arising from heaviness, oiliness,

original: snum pa dang / bsil bar bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: snum pa dang / bsil bar bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: coldness, and so on is to be light, rough, and warm. A disease arising from lightness, roughness, and warmth is to be heavy,🔽oily, and cool.

original: de las rjes 'brel yod //
analyzed: de las rjes 'brel yod //
translated: There is a connection with that.

original: rgyu las go bzlog rnam spang ba //
analyzed: rgyu las go bzlog rnam spang ba //
translated: The opposite of the cause is to be avoided.

original: sman pas ci lta ci lta bar //
analyzed: sman pas ci lta ci lta bar //
translated: The doctor should apply

original: nad las go bzlog sbyar ba'am //
analyzed: nad las go bzlog sbyar ba'am //
translated: the opposite of the disease.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: nad kyi rgyu las go bzlog pa'i sman byas su zin cing /
analyzed: nad kyi rgyu las go bzlog pa'i sman byas su zin cing /
translated: even if the medicine is the opposite of the cause of the disease,

original: nyes pa stobs dang ldan /
analyzed: nyes pa stobs dang ldan /
translated: if the fault is strong,

original: nad dang rjes su 'brel ba yod cing /
analyzed: nad dang rjes su 'brel ba yod cing /
translated: It is related to the disease.

original: shin tu zhen par gyur pa la ni rgyu las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu zhen par gyur pa la ni rgyu las bzlog pa ste /
translated: For those who are very attached, the cause is reversed.

original: nad gzhi dang / rjes su mi mthun pa'i sman spangs shing dor /
analyzed: nad gzhi dang / rjes su mi mthun pa'i sman spangs shing dor /
translated: Avoid and abandon medicine that is not suitable for the disease.

original: sman pas ji ltar rigs shing 'os pa'i sman nad las go bzlog pa'i sman de sbyar bar bya zhing sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: sman pas ji ltar rigs shing 'os pa'i sman nad las go bzlog pa'i sman de sbyar bar bya zhing sbyin par bya ste /
translated: Apply and give the medicine that is suitable and appropriate for the disease, the medicine that reverses the disease.

original: dper na rims la gla sgang dang / par ba ta dang / nas thug sla ba sbyin pa dang / gcin nad la ser po rnam gnyis dang / nas zan la sogs pa sbyin pa dang / mkhris pa gyen du 'byung ba la khrus sman gyis 'og nas gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na rims la gla sgang dang / par ba ta dang / nas thug sla ba sbyin pa dang / gcin nad la ser po rnam gnyis dang / nas zan la sogs pa sbyin pa dang / mkhris pa gyen du 'byung ba la khrus sman gyis 'og nas gdon par bya'o //
translated: For example, for a fever, give la-gang, par-ba-ta, and easy-to-digest barley soup; for a urinary disorder, give the two types of ser-po and barley porridge; for bile rising up, give a bath and medicine to expel it from below.

original: @116a * // de bzhin du nad las go bzlog pa'i gso dpyad kyi bcos pa'i thabs kyi gtso bo rnam pa gnyis dang / las rnam lnga du ba sna nas gtang ba dang / mig sman la sogs pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa bya ba ste /
analyzed: @116a * // de bzhin du nad las go bzlog pa'i gso dpyad kyi bcos pa'i thabs kyi gtso bo rnam pa gnyis dang / las rnam lnga du ba sna nas gtang ba dang / mig sman la sogs pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa bya ba ste /
translated: Similarly, the main methods of treatment that reverse the disease are the two types of treatment, the five actions, blowing smoke through the nostrils, eye medicine, and so on.

original: dper na gla sgang dang par pa ta mkhris pa sel bar byed pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: dper na gla sgang dang par pa ta mkhris pa sel bar byed pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: For example, although the drugs glang-gang and par-pa-ta cure bile disorders,

original: rims 'joms par byed pa de ltar mkhris pa las byung ba'i nad gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rims 'joms par byed pa de ltar mkhris pa las byung ba'i nad gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: they do not cure other disorders arising from bile.

original: dper na skyer pa ni tshil dang / bad kan sel bar byed pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: dper na skyer pa ni tshil dang / bad kan sel bar byed pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: For example, although the drug skyer-pa cures fat and phlegm disorders,

original: gtso cher gcin nad 'joms par byed pa de ltar tshil dang bad kan las byung ba'i nad gzhan dag la ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: gtso cher gcin nad 'joms par byed pa de ltar tshil dang bad kan las byung ba'i nad gzhan dag la ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: it does not cure other disorders arising from fat and phlegm.

original: 'di dag kyang 'og nas slob dpon gyis rgya cher bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang 'og nas slob dpon gyis rgya cher bstan pa yin no //
translated: These will be explained in detail by the Master later.

original: de'i don byed pa sbyor bar bya //
analyzed: de'i don byed pa sbyor bar bya //
translated: One should apply the treatment that accomplishes its purpose.

original: zhes bya ba ni /🔽rgyu dang nad kyi go bzlog pa de'i don byed pa ste /🔽'di ni rgyu dang nad kyi go bzlog pa'i don byed pa'i tshul can yod pas na don byed pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni / rgyu dang nad kyi go bzlog pa de'i don byed pa ste / 'di ni rgyu dang nad kyi go bzlog pa'i don byed pa'i tshul can yod pas na don byed pa ste /
translated: This means:🔽The treatment that accomplishes the purpose of reversing the causes and the disease.🔽This is the treatment that accomplishes the purpose of reversing the causes and the disease.

original: de'i don ni nad kyi gzhi las go bzlog pa dang / nad la go bzlog pa dag la /
analyzed: de'i don ni nad kyi gzhi las go bzlog pa dang / nad la go bzlog pa dag la /
translated: The purpose of this is to reverse the basis of the disease and to reverse the disease.

original: go ma bzlog par gyur pa'i las de'i don byed pa sbyor bar bya ste /
analyzed: go ma bzlog par gyur pa'i las de'i don byed pa sbyor bar bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the action is to apply the antidote without reversing the humors.

original: dper na skyug bro ba la slon sman btang ba'am /🔽tshad pas 'khru ba la khrus bya ba'am /
analyzed: dper na skyug bro ba la slon sman btang ba'am / tshad pas 'khru ba la khrus bya ba'am /
translated: For example, it is like giving medicine to one who is nauseated,🔽giving a bath to one who is feverish,

original: chang nad la chang sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: chang nad la chang sbyin pa'am /
translated: giving beer to one who has a hangover,

original: mes tshig pa la mes bsrod pa 'am /
analyzed: mes tshig pa la mes bsrod pa 'am /
translated: warming with fire one who is cold from a fire,

original: zhi ba dang / rgyas pa'i las bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhi ba dang / rgyas pa'i las bya ba ste /
translated: or performing pacifying and increasing rites.

original: 'di dag ni bsdus pa las rgyas par bshad do //
analyzed: 'di dag ni bsdus pa las rgyas par bshad do //
translated: These are explained in detail in the Condensed Tantra.

original: don gnyis kas byed pa lha rnams la yang brten cing /
analyzed: don gnyis kas byed pa lha rnams la yang brten cing /
translated: Those who perform both types of actions rely on the gods🔽and perform medical applications, giving medicine to one who is nauseated,🔽purifying the impurities of one who is feverish,🔽giving beer to one who has a hangover,🔽warming with fire one who is cold from a fire,

original: sman gyi sbyor ba yang byed pa dang / skyug bro ba la slon sman dang / tshad pas 'khru ba la dri ma sbyang ba dang / chang gi nad la chang blud pa dang / mes tshig pa la me la bsrod pa dang / mkhris pa nang du zhen pa'am /
analyzed: sman gyi sbyor ba yang byed pa dang / skyug bro ba la slon sman dang / tshad pas 'khru ba la dri ma sbyang ba dang / chang gi nad la chang blud pa dang / mes tshig pa la me la bsrod pa dang / mkhris pa nang du zhen pa'am /
translated: and pacifying bile that is internally retained.

original: lam log par song ba la dugs bya ba dang / kha ba dang skyur ba dang bska ba'i ro la brten cing dro ba dang / grang ba'i spyod lam gyis gnas pas phyi rol du gdon cing /
analyzed: lam log par song ba la dugs bya ba dang / kha ba dang skyur ba dang bska ba'i ro la brten cing dro ba dang / grang ba'i spyod lam gyis gnas pas phyi rol du gdon cing /
translated: For those who have gone astray on the path, apply heat, and rely on the tastes of hot, sour, and astringent, and on warm and cold conduct.

original: rang gi lam nas rgyu bar bya ba dang / bad kan nang du zhen cing rengs par gyur pa la /
analyzed: rang gi lam nas rgyu bar bya ba dang / bad kan nang du zhen cing rengs par gyur pa la /
translated: By expelling them externally and moving them through their own path,🔽phlegm that has adhered and become stiff internally

original: phyi rol nas bsil ba'i nye bar spyod pa la gnas pas /
analyzed: phyi rol nas bsil ba'i nye bar spyod pa la gnas pas /
translated: is treated by relying on external cooling conduct.

original: de'i gnod pa nang du zhugs nas /
analyzed: de'i gnod pa nang du zhugs nas /
translated: When the harm from that has entered inside,

original: bad kan gzhu bar bya ste /
analyzed: bad kan gzhu bar bya ste /
translated: the phlegm is to be drawn out.

original: de lta bu'i go bzlog pa'i don byed do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i go bzlog pa'i don byed do //
translated: This is the meaning of the reversal.

original: nyes @116b smin me drod skyes gyur nas //
analyzed: nyes @116b smin me drod skyes gyur nas //
translated: When the faults have ripened and heat is generated,🔽apply unctuous substances,

original: nyams brta snum gyis byugs pa dang // btung dang 'jam rtsi sogs rigs sbyar //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyams brta snum gyis byugs pa dang // btung dang 'jam rtsi sogs rigs sbyar // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and apply the appropriate drink, unctuous nasal medication, and so on.

original: nyes pa rnams smin cing zhu bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: nyes pa rnams smin cing zhu bar gyur pa ni /
translated: As for the faults having ripened and melted,

original: ma zhu ba'i be'u snabs dang / gsud pa la sogs pas nyen pa de ma zhu ba'i nyes pa dang bral bar gyur cing /
analyzed: ma zhu ba'i be'u snabs dang / gsud pa la sogs pas nyen pa de ma zhu ba'i nyes pa dang bral bar gyur cing /
translated: those who are afflicted by indigestion, bezoars, vomiting, and so on, are freed from the faults of indigestion.

original: nyes pa smin nas smyung ba la sogs pa byas pas /
analyzed: nyes pa smin nas smyung ba la sogs pa byas pas /
translated: After the fault has ripened, fasting and so on are done.

original: pho ba'i me drod kyang skyes shing 'phel bar gyur nas nyams brta bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pho ba'i me drod kyang skyes shing 'phel bar gyur nas nyams brta bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: When the digestive heat is born and increases, in order to stabilize the improvement,🔽oils such as sesame oil are applied, medicinal butter is drunk, and the enema is administered.

original: til mar la sogs pa'i snum gyis byug pa dang / sman mar btung ba dang / 'jam rtsi mas gtong ba dag rigs par zhes bya ba yul dang dus la sogs pa'i cha las brtags te /
analyzed: til mar la sogs pa'i snum gyis byug pa dang / sman mar btung ba dang / 'jam rtsi mas gtong ba dag rigs par zhes bya ba yul dang dus la sogs pa'i cha las brtags te /
translated: These are appropriate, meaning that they are to be applied according to the rules, in consideration of the region, season, and so on.

original: cho ga bzhin du sbyar bar bya ba ni phan pa yin no //
